decks.notes: The deck focuses on using cycling cards to fill the graveyard quickly, allowing for a powerful early game with cascade spells like Shardless Agent and Generous Ent. The goal is to set up for a big Living End, which will bring back all creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent. Force of Negation helps protect key combo pieces, while cards like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves provide additional value and card draw. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

This deck revolves around quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to create explosive turns. The deck also includes control elements such as Solitude and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The instant speed reanimation allows for surprise plays and the ability to protect key pieces with counter spells like Force of Negation. Prismatic Ending and Fatal Push provide additional removal options to handle threats. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck is focused on rapid deployment of aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Elegant Parlor to provide additional support and control options. With a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can mount a defense.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the opponent's resources while applying pressure. The key strategy is to use cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to blink creatures like Emperor of Bones and Witch Enchanter for additional value. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude to close out the game quickly. Overall, this deck aims to be both aggressive and disruptive, making it a versatile and powerful choice in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

The primary focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion, before casting powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to deal massive damage to the opponent and win the game. The deck also includes cards like Strike It Rich and Glimpse the Impossible to help with card draw and filter through the library. The goal is to assemble the necessary combo pieces to create a strong storm turn and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to reduce the cost of spells, allowing for big explosive turns with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual. The goal is to generate mana quickly and cast a high storm count spell like Grapeshot to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Artist's Talent and Glimpse the Impossible to draw through the deck and find combo pieces to set up a game-winning turn. The strategy revolves around quickly assembling the necessary pieces to overwhelm the opponent in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana and comboing off with spells that deal damage to the opponent, such as Grapeshot. It includes cards that help dig for key pieces of the combo and reduce the cost of casting spells, as well as ways to replay spells from the graveyard. The deck is built around the synergy between Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate extra mana and deal damage. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

The deck focuses on using Birthing Ritual to quickly ramp into powerful creatures and disruptive spells in order to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and control. By efficiently casting multiple spells in a turn, the deck can maintain pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells and creature removal. The deck's versatility and ability to adapt to different situations make it a formidable opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 match.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal spells to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy effectively. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to ensure resources are consistently flowing. The inclusion of powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide a win condition while the rest of the deck focuses on maintaining control and outlasting the opponent.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with artifacts quickly to overpower the opponent with a flurry of low-cost aggressive creatures and powerful artifact synergies. Utilizing cards like Urza's Saga, Mox Opal, and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to ramp up its artifact count rapidly to enable explosive plays with Engineered Explosives and Weapons Manufacturing. By combining efficient creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Kappa Cannoneer with disruptive spells like Sink into Stupor and Metallic Rebuke, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive and efficient creatures, backed up by removal and combat tricks. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Ocelot Pride, and Guide of Souls to chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm provide additional reach and removal options, while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory help to close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Arena of Glory can disrupt opponent's strategies and give the Boros Aggro player an edge.

The core strategy of this deck is to stall the game with control elements such as counterspells and removal, while ramping up mana with the Urza lands to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator, while also presenting threats that can quickly close out the game like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Ultimately, the key concept of this deck is to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and win conditions.

The deck focuses on assembling the powerful combo of Grinding Station, Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Kethis, the Hidden Hand to generate infinite mill and mana loops. It also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Perfected Mind to protect the combo. The deck uses artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to enable fast and consistent gameplay, while leveraging legendary creatures like Rona, Herald of Invasion and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to further enhance the combo. The land base includes key lands like Urza's Saga and Plaza of Heroes to support the strategy efficiently.

The deck focuses on using creatures with undying or persist abilities to combo with Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, sacrificing and recurring them to generate value and disrupt the opponent's board. Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Malevolent Rumble provide additional ways to abuse creatures entering and leaving the battlefield, while Green Sun's Zenith and Spymaster's Vault help tutor for key pieces. The deck also includes Boseiju, Who Endures to protect key spells and Endurance to disrupt graveyard strategies. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a toolbox of creatures and combo off for a win.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a board presence with efficient artifacts like Memnite and Mox Opal, supported by cards like Thoughtcast for card advantage. It aims to generate fast mana with cards like Urza's Saga and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan while pushing for damage with creatures like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer. The inclusion of Arcbound Ravager and Metallic Rebuke adds versatility and disruption to the deck, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. It aims to deploy threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd while using cards like Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and tempo advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Solitude to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while providing utility lands like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor.
